measured_by: response threshold (b) parameter of the Linear Ballistic Accumulator model
justification: “The magnitude or ‘height’ of the response threshold indicates the level of response caution, where a higher threshold indicates that decision makers require more evidence….”

measured_by: drift-rate parameter of the Linear Ballistic Accumulator model
justification: “The average rate of evidence accumulation—known as the drift rate—indexes the mean speed with which evidence… is accumulated.”

measured_by: non-decision time parameter of the Linear Ballistic Accumulator model
justification: “The time taken for aspects of the observed response time that is not accounted for by the choice process itself… is known as non-decision time.”

measured_by: 1–7 semantic differential scale (Very Slow – Very Fast)
justification: “After every phase of choices, participants rated their perceptions of both their speed … on a 1 to 7 semantic differential scale, anchored by ‘Very Slow’ and ‘Very Fast’.”

measured_by: 1–7 semantic differential scale (Not at all Accurate – Very Accurate)
justification: “Participants rated their perceptions of … their accuracy on a 1 to 7 semantic differential scale, anchored by ‘Not at all Accurate’ and ‘Very Accurate’.”

measured_by: response time (seconds) recorded for each choice
justification: “We analyzed response time data with an ANOVA…,” indicating raw response times served as the metric for decision speed.

measured_by: percent correct score for each phase/task
justification: “We analyzed accuracy data with a logistic regression…,” and tables report “accuracy in percent,” showing percentage correct was the accuracy measure.
